SEARCH
Package model

Klasse Board

java.lang.Object
model.Board
public class Board extends Object
The `Board` class represents the game board for Othello. It includes methods for initializing the board, validating moves, making moves, and accessing the board state.

  • Feldübersicht

    Felder
    Modifizierer und Typ
    Feld
    Beschreibung
    static final int
    BOARD_LENGTH
    The length of the Othello board.
    static final int
    BOARD_WIDTH
    The width of the Othello board.

  • Methodendetails

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard()
      Initializes the Othello game board with starting positions.

    • board

      public Map<String,Character> board()
      Retrieves the internal representation of the game board.
      Gibt zurück:
      A map representing the state of the game board.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(String position, Player currentPlayer)
      Checks if a move at the specified position is valid for the given player.
      Parameter:
      position - The position to check in the format "x,y".
      currentPlayer - The player making the move.
      Gibt zurück:
      `true` if the move is valid, `false` otherwise.

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(String position, Player currentPlayer)
      Makes a move at the specified position for the given player, updating the board state.
      Parameter:
      position - The position to make the move in the format "x,y".
      currentPlayer - The player making the move.

    • getSemaphore

      public Semaphore getSemaphore()
      Retrieves the semaphore used to control access to the board for concurrent threads.
      Gibt zurück:
      The semaphore instance.

    • getBoard

      public Map<String,Character> getBoard()

    • getCellState

      public char getCellState(int x, int y)
      Retrieves the state of the cell at the specified coordinates.
      Parameter:
      x - The x-coordinate of the cell.
      y - The y-coordinate of the cell.
      Gibt zurück:
      The state of the cell at the specified coordinates.
